GameCalc

Gamified calculator -- start with a limited number of buttons and unlock new buttons, operations, and functions by doing calculations. Start from arithmetic and branch out into trigonometry, combinatorics, and logarithms.

Example: 1 + 1 = 2 unlocked!
TextPlay

TextPlay is a music DJ-ing app for event hosts. People at the event can simply text in their song suggestions to be added to the queue in real-time without having to download an app. If multiple people suggest the same song, that song will move up the queue. What separates TextPlay from other social DJ-ing apps is that anyone, even those without smartphones, can participate in song suggestions!

Vigilant

Vigilant is an affordable and hassle-free personal safety app that connects you to friends, family and emergency services without the need to operate your phone (in front of the attacker).

In particular, one has to unplug their headphones from their device to notify their trusted circle of danger. Vigilant sends an sms to the references listed in the trusted circle containing the gps co-ordinates of the location of the danger.

Vigilant also initiates a series of audio/video recordings automatically (typically 10s long), and sends them via email to the trusted circle.

Vigilant tracks crime statistics mined from police crime records and increases the level of response in face of danger.

Try it out

HumIt

Have a nice tune in mind? Simply hum it out and upload it to the website, choose the type of instrument to output, and HumIt will automatically create the instrumental version of your melody! So far we have four instruments available: piano, violin, guitar and flute. More instruments and options are comming. HumIt can also function as an online WAV-MIDI converter. No installation is needed.

Support HumIt. Support music lovers.
ChagolChana / GPSPowerFixer

This is an android application that reduces your battery consumption by giving you the ability to control the GPS usage. Unlike most battery saving application it does not turn your GPS off but it can intelligently know if you are walking or speeding in a car, or in other words knows when you will need a higher connection frequency with the GPS Server and when the frequency can be low. It can adjust the polling frequency according to that saving your precious battery.

It also can track all your location usage (if you want) and later you can use that to recreate the an interactive map to share with others.

BarBack

BarBack is an application that that allows customers to conveniently buy drinks at a bar. Both customers and the bartender will use our application. Customers will be able to log in to the application using their Facebook account, browse the selection of available drinks, and order one through the Android application. The order will be placed in a queue. When the drink is finished being mixed the customer will receive a notification alerting them that there order is ready and they will be charged by their Google Wallet account. After the bartender has notified the customer he can remove the order from the queue.

CSGirls

This app is for our Computer Science Girls Club at the University of Houston, and it brings all of our club resources and interests into one location. We use RSS feeds to post our meeting information, Facebook updates, and useful YouTube videos. We've also included our workshop information, such as resume tips, interview advice, and more.

Hoot

Hoot is a social communication web application targeted towards university students. It gives users a minimalistic interface for communicating with each other. The users can enter any topic(called tags) and it'll allow you to start a conversation(or if other people are already communicating on that tag, it allows you to join the conversation). Tags also have different types such as discussion, buy/sell, career opportunities, groups, misc so that conversations are more focused. Also, when you search for tags, it suggest similar tags to avoid duplication. Plus users can leave a conversation at any time by simply closing that tab and can join back when they want. There is no hassle of joining or subscribing to groups and plus it has an advantage of allowing communication with other people who students don't know in person but may have similar interests. Some example use cases - 1.) Discussing assignments/problems for a particular course with other students who have the same course or are interested. 2.) Buying or selling books gadgets etc. 3.) Discussing career opportunities. 4.) Looking for people with similar interests such as tennis partners or musicians who'd want to jam

Built With

  • php
  • javascript
  • bootstrap
  • web

PicxTale

A single photo tells everything. The app can "hide" any description of photo like "Seattle: the journey to west coast", etc inside a photo. The change to photo is so subtle that user cannot distinguish the difference. Another astounding feature of PicxTale is that it encodes the payment info of an object into a picture and links that infomation to Venmo. Thus you could take a photo of a sushi dish which you payed for your friend and send this photo to him/her, he could use this photo to pay you back.
Dynamic Race Condition Detection & Possible Visualization Through Multi-Threaded Analysis

Our project sought to implement a known difficult problem in dynamically calculating causal relationships between threaded events, specifically relationships between thread reads and writes. By using intel PIN, we are able to instrument and insert our analysis functions, allowing us to track and control execution of an arbitrary target, even without source code producer cooperation. Our targeted analysis, in this particular case, makes a record of every instruction's operation, recording data necessary to make the arduous offline evaluation that could detect further program faults possible (our true final goal). We have implemented a dynamic vector clock, directly from a descriptive and valuable research paper that specifically addressed the shortfall that most vector clocks suffer from, which is that a static number of concurrent processes must be known from the start. With this dynamic vector clock in use, we are able to capture inherently the nature of execution, since as thread spawn and death events occur our tool adapts according, without loss of data accuracy. Our pin tool is meant to track data reads and writes in a novel way, such that, when combined with the vector clock and a periodic intra-thread "window-view" snapshot, a scalable algorithm to detect cases where OS scheduler sequences may or may not resolve such that data inconsistency from memory arises. Therefore, we do not reveal this novel scheme in context of this textual submission (but will discuss it with judges briefly in order that we may substantiate). This first step is critical in finding and exploiting/ameliorating a most difficult class of surreptitious bugs.

Although the Dynamic Vector Clock and the pin tool themselves are currently separated in source, we have devised a method and plan for their integration, and feel absolutely very strongly confident that their integration can be accomplished quickly with only marginal amounts of time required. Further, we believe that the data gathered can be made use of both in automated deep analysis and in contexts involving more human interaction. For example, in replacement of vector clocks, matrix clocks can be employed to realize deeper causal reasoning about inter-thread relationships. While this idea is not novel, the method of employment itself is, and has ample room for expansive research.

Our vision is to place execution records (which are output as simple xml files) in NoSQL containers, thereby inherently capturing the relational nature of execution; data-data association, instruction-data association, data-function, and inter-thread-data relationships are all questions worth deep questioning and advanced analysis. Because these NoSQL containers can scale in areas of transitive relationship exploration and network traversal queries, we believe we are poised to unlock a trove of valuable security artifacts that can be discovered in off-the-shelf software by producing, analyzing and querying these collected datasets.

Further, by creating some rather simple integration scripts between these containers and existing 3D data visualization libraries, and creating our own layout capabilities, we believe it is possible to view these quickly and in an immediately useful and obvious manner.

Modulus Operandi

SIGILL presents Modulus Operandi, an encrypted file storage system that uses a modified Diffie-Hellman encryption protocol to secure data on a remote and potentially hostile server without any ability for the server to access any files. The client is a lightweight, cross-platform command-line utility that interfaces with the server while preventing man-in-the-middle attacks.

Movies Here And Now

The project mentioned here is a context aware mobile application developed on Android and used to enhance movie goers experience.

Features :

  • Gives the user context based notifications for nearby and upcoming movies.
  • When a user is within the vicinity of a theater, he is notified with the next show times for the movies nearby.
  • He can also use this app to view the ratings/description of the movies that are displayed.
  • It will track the user's position and checks if he stayed in the theater for the duration of the movie, then he is asked if he is interested in providing with the rating for the movie. -The users rating can be shared with his friends.
  • The entire data is backed up in the cloud and accessible anywhere from the world with a web browser.

Technical Details:

  • TMS API for fetching the movie details(http://grfx.cstv.com/schools/rice/graphics/logo-temp.png).
  • Google API for fetching the location(https://developers.google.com/places/documentation/).
  • Android Framework for the mobile app using Android Loader API and Android Location API.
  • Web App using PHP/ MySQL.

Total Recall

Have you ever gotten frustrated when you tried to remember when a item was? We have created the solution for you! Total Recall is responsive online webapp that has a RESTful API and allows for users to index their items and locations and "containers" or where exactly the item is stored.

Our indexing and easy to use GUI makes it possible for you to index your important items in seconds using a laptop, tablet, or mobile phone. Then you can easily search for your item when you need it and find it's location in milliseconds!

Never again will you have to spend hours looking for your misplaced keys or those darn christmas decorations.

OwlPlanner++

In November of 2011, Rice’s schedule assisting website went live. This tool, named SchedulePlanner, was designed to assist students in planning their courses for each upcoming semester. Despite SchedulePlanner’s advancements, many students still found it a frustrating, convoluted site to use. OwlPlanner++, with its sleek, clean layout, has an intuitive user-interface that delivers only the information that students are interested in seeing, namely the schedule visualization, course evaluations, professor ratings, and grade distributions. OwlPlanner++ is the improved scheduling tool that Rice students have been waiting for.

The technology used included Python, Javascript, Angular JS, and SQLite3.

LookAround

"LookAround" is an awesome google glass app. The motivation is that we want to create a google glass app to help like-minded students to social in the real world, with all fancy features of google glass. The main function of the app is to create and display events. The event wraps time, location, summary, and attendees together. The event will show up on the google glass as a continuous stream of rectangle cards. As the user moves head around, the event card in his view sight will be highlighted. Entering the next menu, the app enables navigation to the event location, picture taking, gallery reviewing and commenting with voice recognition. It's awesome! Just enjoy it!
